text: Belgium will be scheduled to compete in the 2020 Summer Paralympics in Tokyo, Japan from 25 August to 6 September. == Athletics == ;Men's track {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%" |- |- |Gitte Haenen |Women's 100m T63 | | | | |} ;Women's field {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="3"|Final |- !Result !Points !Rank |- |Gitte Haenen |Women's long jump T63 | | | |} == Boccia == Belgium have qualified to compete at boccia for the first time via world rankings. {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="3"|Preliminaries !Round of 16 !Quarterfinals !Semifinals !colspan="2"|Final |- !Opponent !Opposition Score !Rank !Opposition Score !Opposition Score !Opposition Score |rowspan=3| |rowspan=3| |- align=center |align=left| ||align=center| |- align=center |align=left| ||align=center| |} == Cycling == Belgium is scheduled to compete in cycling at the 2020 Summer Paralympics. ==Goalball== Belgium men's national goalball team qualified by winning the bronze medal at the 2018 Goalball World Championships. ==Swimming== Belgium have qualified one swimmer to compete at the 2020 Summer Paralympics. ;Men {|class=wikitable style="font-size:95%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heats !colspan="2"|Final |- !Result !Rank !Result !Rank |- align=center |align=left|Aymeric Parmentier |align=left|Men's 100m breaststroke SB14 | | | | |} == Table tennis == Laurens Devos and Florian Van Acker qualified to compete at the 2020 Summer Paralympics. ;Men {|class=wikitable style="font-size:95%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="4"|Preliminaries !Quarterfinals !Semifinals !colspan="2"|Final / |- !Opposition Result
